Release Note:
0.11.0 (February 16, 2023)
FEATURES:

server: Add pagination protobuffs and stubs for pagination in ListProjects [link]

IMPROVEMENTS:

cli: module now outputs additional insights
when trying to cancel a running job. [link]
cli: add socket-path flag to runner install [link]
core: module will now retrieve paginated list of jobs to avoid
grpc data limits per request [link]
core: improve runner job stream error logging [link]
install/nomad: Allow mount options to be specified when provisioning a volume with CSI plugins [link]
plugin/aws: Add CORS configuration to lambda-function-url releaser [link]
plugin/tfc: Allow non-string tfc outputs to be used as waypoint.hcl dynamic default variables [link]
plugin/tfc: Allow reading all outputs from a tfc workspace with a single variable stanza [link]
plugins/k8s: Add module option to only prune specific resources [link]
plugins/k8s: Add module to the TaskLauncherConfig (on-demand runner configuration) [link]
server: Add UI_GetDeployment convenience endpoint [link]
server: Enable gRPC-Gateway on the http port of Waypoint server to add in an HTTP API for interfacing [link]

BUG FIXES:

aws/lambda: fix issue where deployment configuration was not injected in to
Lambda function environments, preventing waypoint-entrypoint from authenticating
with the Waypoint server [link]
cli/snapshot: Fix server snapshot when a config source is set. [link]
cli: Fix panic in module and module where
a pipeline run was given with no jobs. [link]
cli: Show full command flags when displaying help text for module. [link]
install/nomad: Fix connectivity to Waypoint server from the CLI at the end of
the Nomad server install. [link]
plugin/aws-ecs: Fix bringing your own alb to ecs deployments. [link]
plugin/k8s-apply: Update the module param to match the updated parameter
in kubectl apply, module. It also ensures this param in the plugin
is optional and not a hard requirement to use the k8s apply plugin. [link]
ui: fix safari bug with xterm/webgl rendering [link]
upgrade: Fixes a bug where pre-v0.10.4 config sources could not be updated or
deleted. [link]

0.10.5 (December 15, 2022)
SECURITY:
* Waypoint now uses Go 1.19.4 to address security vulnerability (CVE-2022-41717) See the Go announcement for more details.
IMPROVEMENTS:

cli: Respect module overrides for submitted job template when running
  module. [link]
config: Remove the multi-app deprecation warning.
  Please see https://discuss.hashicorp.com/t/deprecating-projects-or-how-i-learned-to-love-apps/40888/12 for more information. [link]

BUG FIXES:

plugin/ecs: module now creates aws policies to facilitate remotely running StopTask and WatchTask jobs [link]

0.10.4 (December 08, 2022)
FEATURES:

plugin/ecs: Accept ALB security group IDs. [link]
plugin/packer: A Packer config sourcer plugin to source machine image IDs from
  an HCP Packer channel. [link]

IMPROVEMENTS:

cli/runnerinstall: Check if runner is registered to the server before
  attempting to forget it. [link]
cli/runnerinstall: Delete EFS file system during ECS runner uninstall. [link]
cli: module requires the module or module flag regardless of where it's run. [link]
cli: Pipeline run now shows the number of steps successfully executed for a failed run. [link]

BUG FIXES:

cli/context: Fix possible error when listing contexts if a non-Waypoint context file exists in the context directory. [link]
cli: Ensure a deploy and release URL has a scheme included if not set. [link]
cli: module now successfully destroys a project created in the UI without a remote source or local waypoint.hcl file. [link]
plugin/nomad: Update Nomad task launcher plugin to use module config - fixes
  pipeline exec steps run in Nomad. [link]
plugin/vault: Fix usage of dynamic secrets from Vault for dynamic Waypoint app
  config. [link]

0.10.3 (November 03, 2022)
FEATURES:

plugin/consul: Consul key-value data config sourcer plugin [link]

IMPROVEMENTS:

cli/config-sync: Add operations flags to module command. [link]
cli/fmt: Add a module flag that will determine if the module is already
properly formatted, similar to module. [link]
cli/pipeline_run: Show app deployment and release URLs if exist from running
pipeline. Also show input variables used. [link]
cli: Add prune flags to module for configuring the automatic release. [link]
cli: Introduce new CLI flag module for module which will stream
an existing pipeline run either by the latest known run or a specific sequence id. [link]
cli: Only echo file name when config file is formatted with module. [link]
cli: Update module to show default runner profile
if no name argument supplied. [link]
core: Auto run a status report after a deployment or release operation rather
than only if module or module CLI is run. [link]
core: Combine git clone messages from job stream into a single message [link]
pipelines: Add ability to evaluate input variables in pipelines stanzas. [link]
ui/input-variables: Adds the ability to set an input variable as sensitive and hides its value from the list and form [link]

BUG FIXES:

cli/runner-profile-set: Fix panic when setting runner profile environment variables [link]
cli/upgrade: Update the OCI URL for the bootstrap runner profile during module [link]
cli: Fix bug where input variables were not included on pipeline run jobs. [link]
cli: Fix panic in module when no flags are specified. [link]
cli: Fix panic in cli for module if attempting to cancel by run
job id with no argument. [link]
cli: Only show "CompleteTime" on module if the job has a valid
complete time. [link]
cli: Remove automatic uppercasing of ids, so that future runner profiles will match [link]
cli: Respect the -workspace flag when requesting a logstream for a deployment
by workspace [link]
core: Fix panic if no Use stanza found for given workspace scope on a build,
deploy, release, or registry stanza. [link]
core: fix panic when null value is set on a string variable [link]
install/nomad: Update installation with Nomad to use CSI parameters. [link]

plugin/docker: fix issue with authenticating with registries when using

plugin/ecs: Implement WatchTask plugin for AWS ECS task launcher. Store ECS on-demand runner logs in the job system. [link]
plugin/docker: Add new module plugin for a build noop for referencing a Docker Image [link]

BUG FIXES:

cli/install: Set image pull policy configuration on Helm installation of Waypoint server and runner [link]
cli: Fix panic when setting project datasource to local [link]

core: Fix out of order job ids for module job stream CLI. [link]
plugin/nomad-jobspec: Fix deployment of periodic and system Nomad jobs. [link]

0.10.1 (September 22, 2022)
IMPROVEMENTS:

BUG FIXES:

plugin/nomad: Update Nomad task launcher plugin to respect namespace and region
configs in runner profile [link]
plugin: Fix panic in non-ECS plugins when destroying resources [link]
runner-install/k8s: Use the service account created by helm in the runner profile, rather than using the default service account. [link]
runner-install/kubernetes: Fix the static runner image used in the module command [link]

0.10.0 (September 13, 2022)
FEATURES:

core: Custom Pipelines as a Tech Preview gives users the ability to define custom pipelines to run various Waypoint actions such as a build, deploy, release, up and more for deploying applications. Waypoint will monitor and log each pipeline run, associated jobs, and show the results of executing that pipeline. [link]
core: Project Destroy Introduce a new CLI command module to delete projects in Waypoint and destroy their associated resources [link]
CLI: New waypoint.hcl interactive generator, accessed with module when no waypoint.hcl exists in the current project [link]

IMPROVEMENTS:

CLI: Nomad CSI volumes names can be specified during installation and upgrades for both Waypoint runners and Waypoint server installations [link]
cli/runnerinstall: The runner profile created by module sets target labels
instead of a target runner ID on the runner profile, if the user supplied label flags [link]
cli: Add option to module command to get a specific deployment's logs [link]
cli: Fix incorrect description for module command. [link]
cli: Implement module to allow users to attach to running job
streams and receieve output, or get the output from an existing job stream that
already finished. [link]
cli: Internal-only labels on runners are hidden from CLI output for module and module [link]
install/runner: Allow additional arguments for module command
to be supplied to module CLI [link]
internal/runnerinstall: Fix order of error checking and make error message more specific [link]
plugin/k8s: Add ephemeral-storage resource limits to on-demand runners through runner profiles. [link]
plugin/nomad: Implement WatchTask plugin for Nomad task launcher. Store Nomad on-demand runner logs in the job system. [link]
plugin/nomad: nomad-jobspec deployments will no longer utilize the
nomad-jobspec-canary releaser by default. [link]
serverinstall/ecs: Improve server upgrade process by stopping task and reducing
target group drain time [link]
ui: Fix header spacing on build/release detail pages [link]
ui: Make it clearer that remote runners are required for GitOps [link]
ui: Update alert copy to reflect change that we are no longer removing project definitively in 0.10.0 [link]

BUG FIXES:

cli/install/k8s: Fixes the k8s installer race condition with the bootstrap token [link]
cli/runnerinstall: Fix output error message for missing arguments on Nomad runner installation [link]
cli/runnerinstall: The runner profile created by module no longer sets
the profile as the default, and appends the runner ID to the name of the profile
for uniqueness [link]
cli/serverinstall/nomad: Add service discovery provider configuration
to server install for Nomad. [link]
cli: Do not set runner profile defaultness to false if default flag not specified. [link]
cli: Fix issue where the CLI would exit with no error or action taken if a local
  waypoint.hcl file was invalid [link]
cli: Fix order of CLI outputs during install [link]
cli: Only show runner profile default deletion hint if more than 0 default
profiles are detected on upgrades. [link]
cli: Set plugin configuration on runner profile created during module [link]
cli: Set the subnet and security group ID configs for the ECS task launcher plugin
during an ECS runner install [link]
cli: module will now attempt to destroy any known resources for failed
deployments. Previously, module would skip unsuccessful deployments. [link]
cli: module deletes by name rather than the user-invisible ID. [link]
cli: module does not create entries with duplicate names. [link]
core/runner: Default to odr oci image url for runner profiles created via runner install [link]
core/runner: Server no longer panics when a runner stopped after it is forgotten. [link]
core: prune releases which released deployments that are being pruned during
a release [link]
internal/pkg/gitdirty: Fix an issue detecting dirty local source code when using git@ remotes. [link]
plugin/nomad-jobspec-canary: Retrieve the status of the correct Nomad job for the
job resource [link]
ui: Add label to “follow logs” button [link]
ui: Make UI more resilient to invalid state JSON [link]
upgrade: Nomad server upgrade upgrade now detects runners with the name
module or module [link]
upgrade: Update ECS server upgrade to respect -ecs-server-image flag when the
existing server image is hashicorp/waypoint:latest [link]

0.9.1 (July 28, 2022)
IMPROVEMENTS:

core: Adds string module function for HCL configs [link]
plugin/nomad: Convert Nomad job for ODR to batch job [link]

BUG FIXES:

internal: Fix deprecation warning being fatal [link]
plugin/tfc: Fix HCL field, module [link]

0.9.0 (July 05, 2022)
FEATURES:

Waypoint Task Tracking: Waypoint now tracks the lifecycle of on-demand
runner tasks through a new internal core concept module. As ODR jobs run, Task
will keep track of what part the jobs are at for better debugging and on-demand
runner insight. [link]
cli: New module and module commands to install/uninstall Waypoint runners to a specified platform [link]
cli: New module command to delete a Waypoint runner profile [link]
cli: Refactor k8s server install to use Helm [link]
core: Add ability to have cli and runners use OAuth2 to get an auth token [link]
plugin/aws-ecr-pull: Introduces an module builder plugin
that enables using AWS ECR images that are built outside of Waypoint. [link]
plugin/lambda-function-url: Adds a new plugin and module component. This leverages Lambda URLs. [link]

IMPROVEMENTS:

cli: Show list of existing default runner profiles on post-upgrade to warn user
that only one runner profile should be default. [link]
cli: Add interactive input for server upgrade, server uninstall, and destroy commands [link]
cli: Remove unused flag module in module [link]
core/api: include commit message in datasource/git response [link]
core: on-demand runner logs are now captured from the underlying platform
and stored in the job system. [link]
core: show helpful errors when using invalid runner profile plugin config [link]
plugin/nomad: Support Nomad service discovery in Nomad platform plugin [link]
runner: runners will now accept and execute multiple jobs concurrently
if multiple jobs are available. On-demand runners continue to execute exactly
one job since they are purpose launched for single job execution. [link]
server: Introduce basic server-side metric collections around operations [link]
serverinstall/k8s: By default, do not set a mem or cpu limit or request for
the default runner profile installed. [link]
ui: Updated UI of breadcrumbs and UX to include current page [link]
upgrade: Warn user if default k8s runner profile has incorrect plugin configs [link]

DEPRECATIONS:

config: More than one app stanza within a waypoint.hcl file is deprecated, and will be removed in 0.10. Please see https://discuss.hashicorp.com/t/deprecating-projects-or-how-i-learned-to-love-apps/40888 for more information.

Since the initial version of Waypoint, the product has supported the ability to configure multiple apps within a single waypoint.hcl file. This functionality is deprecated and will be removed in the next release. The vast majority of users are not using this functionality and it served mostly as a source of confusion for users. For users who are using a monorepo pattern, we plan to add better workflows for you.
With a waypoint.hcl now focused on the configuration of a single application, the concept of a project within the Waypoint data model will be removed, moving applications to the top level. This is already how users talk about using Waypoint and we are confident that it will improve the overall understanding of Waypoint as well.
If you have questions about this change in functionality, we invite you to discuss with us at https://discuss.hashicorp.com/t/deprecating-projects-or-how-i-learned-to-love-apps/40888 or https://github.com/hashicorp/waypoint/issues.
[link]

cli: fix panic when running status report on app with zero prior deployments [link]
core: Fix a rare panic when generating an invite token. [link]
plugin/docker: Ensure that the docker task launcher does not require a resources
block to be set when attempting to load a task config to launch a task. [link]

0.8.1 (April 08, 2022)

0.8.0 (April 07, 2022)
FEATURES:

Targetable Runners with Labels: Waypoint now supports runner profiles that target specific on-demand runners by labels.
Projects and/or Apps can be configured to use a specific runner profile, identified by name.
The runner profile will target all operations to a specific on-demand runner by ID, or labels on the runner. [link]
cli: Introduce a new CLI command for job management and inspection
module. [link]
core, cli: Support setting variables to module and obfuscate those values in outputs [link]
plugin/nomad: Nomad jobspec canary promotion releaser [link]

IMPROVEMENTS:

cli: Add module command [link]
cli: Add a way for module to set the Waypoint server platform [link]
cli: Display count of instance connections in deployment status reports [link]
cli: Introduce a module flag to attempt to force cancel a job [link]
cli: Print operation sequence ids and pushed artifact id [link]
cli: module shows runner labels [link]
cli: module deprecates the module flag in favor of the module flag instead. [link]
cli: module command set now supports target runner labels [link]

or becomes unavailable during the startup process [link]
core: runners can have labels, which are used for targeting and metadata [link]
core: runners can tolerate a server outage during job execution and will
wait for the server to come back online [link]
plugin/aws-ecr: Output module from Docker image input [link]
plugin/ecs: Add module aws-ecs parameter
to support deploying Docker images built by the Apple M1 chip on ECS [link]
plugin/aws-lambda: Default lambda architecture to Docker/ECR image architecture [link]
plugin/docker: Output module from Docker builder [link]

Targetable Runners: Allow apps and projects to target specific runner profiles.
Allow runner profiles to target specific remote runners. [link]
Introduce executing Trigger URL configurations via HTTP. Users can
start a trigger via HTTP and stream the job event stream output directly over

BUG FIXES:

0.7.1 (January 25, 2022)
IMPROVEMENTS:

0.7.0 (January 13, 2022)
FEATURES:

Source variable values from remote systems: The default value for input variables
can now use the module function to source data from Vault, Consul,
Terraform Cloud, and more. This is a pluggable system. [link]
Workspace and Label-scoped Configuration: Build, registry, deploy, and
release configurations can now be changed depending on the current workspace
or label sets. This can be used to alter configurations between environments
(staging, production, etc.) or metadata (region, etc.). [link]
core: Introduce RunTriggers to Waypoint Server and CLI. Triggers can be configured
ahead of time to execute lifecycle operations on demand through the Waypoint API.
Currently, only the gRPC API is supported, but in the future an HTTP endpoint
will be added to be used within CI. [link]
ui/auth: users can now authenticate through the UI using an OIDC provider [link]
ui: Add Exec Terminal to the web UI [link]
ui: Added a tab with an overview of the resources provisioned by operations [link]
ui: Added timeline component to artifact details pages [link]
ui: Update UI of builds and releases tab [link]
ui: add workspace switcher to app pages [link]
ui: reformatted app overview page and header of artifact details page [link]

IMPROVEMENTS:

cli: Add alias for -app and -workspace flags [link]
cli: Add new module command [link]
cli: Deprecate -remote flag for operations, replace with -local flag [link]
cli: Enhance warning for project flag mismatches when project parsed from config [link]
cli: Report where each operation runs (locally vs remotely) [link]
cli: Warn if about to perform a remote operation with a dirty local git state [link]
install/nomad: Ensure static runner has started during install by validating its
running status for a few seconds once it is in a "running" state. [link]
plugin/docker: inject module Waypoint entrypoints for arm images [link]
plugin/ecs: Implement the destruction of AWS resources created when deploying a workspace [link]
plugin/pack: detect non-Intel Docker server and show a warning [link]
serverinstall/ecs: Add permissions to the ECS runner IAM policy to allow the removal of security groups and de-registration of task [link]
serverinstall: Set Nomad's ODR profile name to "nomad" [link]
ui: Improved UX of screen readers' transition between pages [link]
ui: Updated list items UI on deployments tab [link]
ui: Updated the deployments tab UI/UX [link]
ui: upgraded icons to flight icons library [link]

BREAKING CHANGES:

core: module has been renamed to module. The existing function
name continues to work but is deprecated and may be removed in a future version. [link]
plugin/docker: module-based Dockerless builds are no longer supported.
Dockerless builds are still fully supported via Kaniko and on-demand
runners that shipped in Waypoint 0.6. Static runners without access to
a Docker daemon can no longer build images. [link]

core: Automatically remotely init projects with a Git data source [link]

core: Easier to understand error messages when using incompatible plugins [link]
core: Server with custom TLS certificates will automatically reload and rotate
the TLS certificates when they change on disk [link]
plugin/docker: Add support for multi-stage Dockerfile builds [link]
plugin/k8s: Add new ability to release by creating an ingress resource to route
traffic to a service backend from an ingress controller. [link]
plugin/k8s: Introduce a new config option module, which creates a horizontal
pod autoscaler for each deployment. [link]
plugin/k8s: Introduce a new config option module and module for defining
resource limits and requests for a pod in a deployment. [link]
plugin/k8s: Use sequence number in k8s deployment name for improved traceability to waypoint deployments. [link]
ui: Display project remote initialization state [link]
ui: Gitops users not using Git polling can run "Up" from the browser [link]
ui: Improve design of status row on Build/Deployment/Release detail pages [link]
ui: Improve tab styles for dark mode [link]
ui: Toggle checkboxes are nicely styled in dark mode [link]
ui: Improve the input field for server-side HCL file on the settings page [link]
ui: The rendering of the Application and Operation Logs has been greatly improved [link]

BUG FIXES:

cli: Fix a panic in module when no successful release is available [link]
cli: Fix logic on when a rocket indicator shows in module [link]
config: Fix dynamic config vars targeting files. [link]
entrypoint: Fix issue injecting waypoint-entrypoint multiple times [link]
plugin/docker: Resolve image identifiers properly [link]
plugin/docker: Support SSH hosts for entrypoint injection [link]
plugin/k8: Setup Kubernetes services for different workspaces properly [link]
server: Adds API validation to ensure server doesn't panic when given an empty
request body [link]
server: Validate GetDeployment request has a valid request body to avoid a server
panic. [link]
ui: Fixed config variable duplication when renaming [link]
ui: Notification messages display nicely when containing long words such as URLs [link]

0.5.2 (September 09, 2021)
FEATURES:

cli: Add a new command for inspecting project information, module. [link]

IMPROVEMENTS:

plugin/aws-ecs: Allow configuration of ALB subnets independently of service subnets [link]
plugin/aws-ecs: Allow public ip assignment for tasks to be disabled [link]
plugin/aws-ecs: Deployments delete their resources on failure. [link]
plugin/aws-ecs: Error messages contain additional context [link]
plugin/aws-ecs: Improve security of ECS tasks by restricting ingress to the ALB [link]
plugin/aws-ecs: More complete list of resources displayed in module logs [link]
plugin/aws-ecs: Support for status reports, enabling module for ECS deployments [link]
plugin/aws: Add ability to pass IAM policy ARNs for attaching to task role [link]

BUG FIXES:

internal/config: Fix parsing of complex HCL types in module [link]
plugin/aws-ecs: Fix panic when specifying a sidecar without a health check [link]
plugin/nomad: Only use non-empty job.StatusDescription for HealthMessage [link]
server/singleprocess: Stop returning error when polling an app with no deployment or release [link]
ui: Fix leaky project repository settings being reused when creating a new project [link]

IMPROVEMENTS:

plugin/aws/ecs: Fix destroy non-latest deployments in ECS [GH-2054]

0.5.0 (August 12, 2021)
FEATURES:

Status Reports: Waypoint now has multiple improvements to support status
checks for deployed resources. See module for more.
Input variables: Waypoint now allows users to parameterize the waypoint.hcl
file through an input variable system. [link]
OIDC Authentication and User Accounts: Waypoint now has a user account system
and can be configured to sign up and log in users using any OIDC provider
such as Google, GitLab, etc. [link]
cli: can login with a token using the new module command [link]
cli: new "waypoint user" CLI for user management [link]
core: platform plugins may now advertise deployment-specific URLs [link]
ui: Show deployment URL if available [link]
ui: added button on individual artifact (deployments + releases) page for on demand health checks [link]

IMPROVEMENTS:

Status reports: server: Continuously generate a status report for an application after the initial
deployment or release for projects backed by a git data source [link]
cli: Adds a module flag to module [link]
core: git poller setting to optionally ignore changes outside of the configured project path [link]
entrypoint: Can disable module only by setting the
module environment variable to a truthy value. [link]
plugin/aws/alb: Update ALB Releaser to use new SDK Resource Manager [link]
plugin/aws/ecs: Add ability to specify security group IDs [link]
plugin/docker: Enables image build for specified platform [link]
plugin/google: Add non-blocking alert if unable to delete revision [link]
plugin/google: Implement DestroyWorkspace to cleanup all created resources [link]
plugin/google: Update Google Cloud platform to use SDK Resource Manager [link]

plugin/k8s: Include deployment and release resources in module output. [link]
plugin/k8s: Update K8s Releaser to use SDK Resource Manager [link]
plugin/k8s: Updates release status report to check k8s service status [link]
plugin/nomad: Add consul service optional flags [link]
plugin/nomad: Update Nomad platform to use SDK Resource Manager [link]
ui: Add ability to add input variables in the project settings UI [link]
ui: Add dynamic page titles [link]
ui: Add git commit SHAs to operations in the browser UI [link]
ui: Update authentication page with new supported module command. [link]

BUG FIXES:

plugin/aws-alb: Fix issue destroying when Target Group still in use [link]
plugin/docker: Fix docker buildkit build failures [link]
plugin/nomad: Fix case where nomad error would be ignored during a status check [link]
plugin/k8s: Fix module configurability [link]
serverinstall/ecs: Handle errors when resources are already destroyed [link]

0.4.2 (July 22, 2021)

0.4.1 (July 1, 2021)

cli: Fix incorrect description for module command [link]

BUG FIXES:

builtin/k8s: Fix module configurability [link]

cli: Fix crash that could occur when running commands outside the context of a project with an hcl config file. [link]
cli: Prevent use of operation flags on module command [link]
cli: Set runner poll interval default for runner defined in waypoint.hcl [link]
cli: List deployments shows status for each deployment [link]
core: Fix crash that could occur when using module with certain HCL files [link]

serverinstall/k8s: Accept k8s-namespace when uninstalling server [link]

0.4.0 (June 03, 2021)
FEATURES:

Mutable Deployments: Waypoint now supports the concept of "mutable" deployments
where a deployment updates an existing resource rather than creating something
new. New plugins in this release include deploying from a Nomad job file,
Kubernetes apply from a directory or file, and more. [link]
Status Reports: Waypoint now supports a new feature for reporting
on the health of deployments or releases. Waypoint surfaces a deployment
and or releases status by relying on an existing platform for health checks.
A status is responsible for reporting the health of a deployed service by
representing its states as Ready, Alive, Partial, Down, or Unknown.
Platform health reporting lets teams take action quickly depending on the health
of their applications. Currently, the Kubernetes, Nomad, AWS ALB, and Docker built-in
plugins support the new Status reporting, with more support on the way! [link]
config: Add ability to define internal variables and compose variables together via templating [link]
config: Add ability to write configuration values as files rather than environment variables. [link]
config: module and module functions for processing Jsonnet files
and converting them to JSON. [link]
plugin/aws-alb: Report on status of releases [link]
plugin/docker: Add reporting on status of a deployment [link]
plugin/k8s: A new plugin "kubernetes-apply" that is able to deploy any typical
directory of YAML or JSON files to Kubernetes [link]
plugin/k8s: Add reporting on status of a deployment and release [link]
plugin/nomad: A new plugin "nomad-jobspec" for deploying a Nomad job specification directly. [link]
plugin/nomad: Add reporting on status of a deployment [link]
server/ecs: Use module to install waypoint server to
AWS ECS using Fargate [link]
ui: Add reporting on status of a deployment [link]
ui: Mutable deployments support on web dashboard. [link]

IMPROVEMENTS:

internal/config: add module variable [link]
plugin/pack: Support for non-default process types [link]
plugins/docker: Add support build context [link]

BUG FIXES:

plugin/k8s: destroy deployment on error [link]
plugin/pack: Upgrade pack package to fix downloading remote buildpacks [link]
server: Fix a bug that sometimes sends duplicate cancellation messages [link]
server: fix order of log lines when showing logs from multiple instances [link]
ui/checkbox-inputs-safari: Custom Inputs in the browser Ui now render properly on all supported browsers [link]
ui: unread log count resets after scrolling [link]

BREAKING CHANGES:

plugin/netlify: Removed the netlify plugin [link]

IMPROVEMENTS:

BUG FIXES:

plugin/aws/ecs: Fix bug where certificate and other fields had to be set to empty string to use listener. [link]
plugin/aws/ecs: Retry actions that cross AWS service boundaries to fix eventual consistency issues. [link]
plugin/pack: Honor DOCKER_HOST properly [link]

0.3.1 (April 20, 2021)
IMPROVEMENTS:

entrypoint: can change log level using the module env var, which can also be set with module [link]
entrypoint: default log level changed to DEBUG [link]
plugin/nomad: Add CPU and Memory resource options for server and runner installs, and app deploys [link]
plugin/nomad: Allow for auth soft fail on serverinstall for server image [link]
ui: Improve the design of the Project Settings forms [link]

BUG FIXES:

cli: connections with TLS without insecure flag properly connect [link]
cli: server bootstrap will not give auth token errors [link]
plugin/aws/ecs: Route 53 "A" Type record properly created when not found for domain name [link]
plugin/nomad: use namespace config option for deploy [link]

0.3.0 (April 08, 2021)
BREAKING CHANGES:

ui: dropped support for Internet Explorer [GH-1075]

FEATURES:

GitOps: Poll for changes and automatically run module. Waypoint
  can now trigger a full build, deploy, release cycle on changes detected in Git. [GH-1109]
Runners: Run Waypoint operations remotely. Runners are standalone processes that
  run operations such as builds, deploys, etc. remotely. [GH-1167] [GH-1171]
AWS Lambda: Add support for building and deploying AWS Lambda workloads [GH-1097]
Dockerless image builds: Waypoint can now build, tag, pull, and push
  Docker images in unprivileged environments without a Docker daemon. [GH-970]
cli: New module command will autoformat your module files [GH-1037]
config: module function allows you to avail the current date and time in your Waypoint configuration. [link]
ui: Add ability to create a project from the browser UI [link]
ui: Add ability to configure a project's git settings from the browser UI [link]
ui: Add ability to input a waypoint.hcl configuration from the browser UI [link]

IMPROVEMENTS:

cli: Require confirmation before destroying all resources [link]
cli: Can specify the number of deployments to prune for module and module. [link]
cli: Support and render new documentation subfields [link]
plugin/docker-pull: doesn't require Docker if no registry is configured and entrypoint injection is disabled [link]
plugin/k8s: Add new probe configuration options [link]
plugin/k8s: plugin will attempt in-cluster auth first if no kubeconfig file is specified [GH-1052] [GH-1103]
server: Prune old deployments and jobs from server memory. This limits the number
of deployments and jobs to 10,000. The data for the old entries is still stored on disk
but it is not indexed in memory, to allow data recovery should it be needed. [link]

BUG FIXES:

core: default releasers initialize properly when they use HCL variables [link]
cli: require at least one argument [GH-1188]
plugin/aws/alb: clamp alb name per aws limits [link]
ui: output failed build errors in logs [link]

FEATURES:

Uninstall command for all server platforms:
Use module to remove the Waypoint server and artifacts from the
specified module for the active server installation. [GH-972]
Upgrade command for all server platforms:
Use module to upgrade the Waypoint server for the
specified module for the active server installation. [GH-976]

0.2.0 (December 10, 2020)
FEATURES:

Application config syncing with Kubernetes (ConfigMaps), Vault, Consul, and AWS SSM;
Automatically sync environment variable values with remote sources and restart your
application when those values change. [GH-810]
Access to Artifact, Deploy Metadata: module and module configuration can use 
module variable syntax to access metadata from the results of those stages. 
The module configuration can use module and module to access metadata.
For example: module for Docker-based builds. [GH-757]
module Functions: module, module, and module functions
allow you to template files, directories, and strings with the variables and functions
available to your Waypoint configuration. 
module Variables: you can now use module, module, and module as
variables in your Waypoint file to specify paths as relative to the project (waypoint.hcl
file), app, or pwd of the CLI invocation.
Server snapshot/restore: you can now use the CLI or API to take and restore online
snapshots. Restoring snapshot data requires a server restart but the restore operation 
can be staged online. [GH-870]

IMPROVEMENTS:

cli/logs: entrypoint logs can now be seen alongside app logs and are colored differently [GH-855]
contrib/serverinstall: Automate setup of kind+k8s with metallb [GH-845]
core: application config changes (i.e. module) will now restart running applications [GH-791]
core: add more descriptive text to include app name in module [GH-807]
core: add better error messaging when prefix is missing from the module flag in module [GH-815]
core: align -raw flag to behave like -json flag with waypoint config set [GH-828]
core: module can be named module and use JSON syntax [GH-867]
install: Update flags used on server install per-platform [GH-882]
install/k8s: support for OpenShift [GH-715]
internal/server: Block on instance deployment becoming available [GH-881]
plugin/aws-ecr: environment variables to be used instead of 'region' property for aws-ecr registry [GH-841]
plugin/google-cloud-run: allow images from Google Artifact Registry [GH-804]
plugin/google-cloud-run: added service account name field [GH-850]
server: APIs for Waypoint database snapshot/restore [GH-723]
website: many minor improvements were made in our plugin documentation section for this release
